Development Environments

It is necessary to set-up the programming environment to ensure that all the required tools are set-up to successfully write the code, compile and run applications on Talaria TWO.

Linux

Environment Set-up for Linux

Procedure to set-up the development environment for Talaria TWO SDK on an Ubuntu VirtualBox with a Windows 10 host.

  • Software Installation
    • VirtualBox Ubuntu 20.04
  • Standalone Ubuntu 20.04
    • Prerequisites for the User
  • Standalone Ubuntu 21.04
    • Prerequisites for the User

Procedure to build and debug an application on Eclipse IDE in Linux using Talaria TWO SDK.

  • Prerequisites
  • JDK Installation
  • Prerequisites for Eclipse
    • Installing Necessary Packages
    • Install GNU Toolchain for ARM Embedded
    • Installing GDB in Linux
    • Installing OpenOCD
  • Linux - Eclipse IDE installer
  • Linux – Eclipse IDE Installation
  • Connecting the EVB
  • Starting Eclipse IDE
  • Eclipse Plugin: InnoPhase IoT Software Development Tool for Application Development
    • InnoPhase IoT Software Development Tool Installation
    • Download and Configure Support Files for Plugin
    • Import Talaria TWO Example Project
    • Run Configuration Set-up
    • Debug Configuration Set-up
  • Application Development - Manual Procedure
    • Import Talaria TWO Example Project
    • Configuring the Eclipse Project
    • Building Application in Eclipse
    • Debug Configuration Setting up in Eclipse
    • Programming Talaria TWO EVB
    • Debugging in Eclipse

Windows Subsystem for Linux

Procedure for developing an application using Windows Subsystem for Linux and Talaria TWO SDK.

  • Prerequisites
    • Windows Subsystem for Linux
    • Installing Linux
    • Installing Necessary Packages
    • Accessing WSL Files from Windows
    • Install arm-none-eabi Toolchain
    • Install Python3 and packages
    • Setting Execute Permissions for SDK Scripts
    • Programming Talaria TWO using Download Tool
